details.description: Opening hours: Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5pm. Consular phone lines are open from 9am to 4pm.
details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

Opening hours British Embassy: Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5pm / Opening hours British Consulate: Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 1.30pm. Consular phone lines are open from 9am to 4pm.

2018 public holidays

Our offices will be closed for the following public holidays in 2018:

Date Public holiday  
Monday 1 January New Year’s Day
Thursday 29 March Maundy Thursday
Friday 30 March Good Friday
Monday 2 April Easter Monday
Tuesday 1 May Fiesta del Trabajo
Wednesday 2 May Fiesta de la Comunidad de Madrid
Tuesday 15 May San Isidro (local)
Friday 12 October Fiesta Nacional de España
Thursday 1 November Día de Todos los Santos
Friday 9 November La Almudena (local)
Thursday 6 December Constitution Day
Monday 24 December Christmas Eve
Tuesday 25 December Christmas Day
Wednesday 26 December Boxing Day

Map

You can find a map of our office location on our Google Map page.

Disabled access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors including lifts and ramps for wheelchairs. If you need special assistance, please contact us before your visit.

Security regulations

The British Embassy Madrid security regulations, in line with all British diplomatic missions world-wide, do not permit visitors to enter the embassy with mobile telephones, laptops, PDAs or any other similar electrical devices. We prefer that you arrive at the embassy without them. If this is not possible we will retain them at the entrance during your visit. Visitors are required to pass through a number of security checks where such items will be detected.

Weapons (including pepper sprays), or any object that our security staff consider could be used as a weapon (scissors, screwdrivers, small blades), are also forbidden. These will not be retained by our staff. Should you arrive with such an object you will not be granted access but will be asked to return without it.

These regulations are intended to help us ensure the security for our staff and visitors. Your co-operation is appreciated.

Parking

Unfortunately there is no public parking in Torre Espacio itself. The nearest public car park is La Paz car park, which is next to the Hospital La Paz and directly opposite Torre Espacio.

La Paz car park can be accessed via Calle del Arzobispo Morcillo, next to the Hospital de la Paz on the north side of Torre Espacio. The car park offers:

  • 24 hour service
  • emergency battery for starting vehicles
  • wheelchair hire service
  • discount vouchers for business premises and available advertising spots

More details on La Paz car park can be found on the MetroVacesa website

If La Paz car park is full, there is a large public car park at Plaza Castilla (about 15 minutes walk from our offices). To get to the consulate-general from Plaza Castilla, take the metro to Begoña - see instructions below on how to arrive by metro.

Bus

For those who prefer to travel by bus to Torre Espacio you can find detailed information on Madrid’s municipal transport website where you can plan your personalised route.

Metro

The nearest metro stop is metro Begoña (linea 10). When arriving at the station Begoña take the exit sign posted La Paz or you will have a much longer walk to the Torre Espacio. Route maps and service information can be found on the MetroMadrid website.

details.description: Journalists and media only can contact the Press Office via the main Embassy number. Calls outside office hours may be diverted to the FCO’s London newsdesk.

Disabled access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors including lifts and ramps for wheelchairs. If you need special assistance, please contact us before your visit.

Security regulations

The British Consulate General Madrid security regulations, in line with all British diplomatic missions world-wide, do not permit visitors to enter the consulate with mobile telephones, laptops, PDAs or any other similar electrical devices. We prefer that you arrive without them. If this is not possible we will retain them at the entrance during your visit. Visitors are required to pass through a number of security checks where such items will be detected.

Visitors will not be permitted to bring luggage (suitcases or large bags) into the building. There is a left luggage place known as “Consigna” at Charmartin train station. It is open Monday to Sunday from 07:00h to 23:00h.

Weapons (including pepper sprays), or any object that our security staff consider could be used as a weapon (scissors, screwdrivers, small blades), are also forbidden. These will not be retained by our staff. Should you arrive with such an object you will not be granted access but will be asked to return without it.

These regulations are intended to help us ensure the security for our staff and visitors. Your co-operation is appreciated.

Unfortunately there is no public parking in Torre Espacio itself. The nearest public car park is La Paz car park, which is next to the Hospital La Paz and directly opposite Torre Espacio.

La Paz car park can be accessed via Calle del Arzobispo Morcillo, next to the Hospital de la Paz on the north side of Torre Espacio. The car park offers:

  • 24 hour service
  • emergency battery for starting vehicles
  • wheelchair hire service
  • discount vouchers for business premises and available advertising spots

If La Paz car park is full, there is a large public car park at Plaza Castilla (about 15 minutes walk from our offices). To get to the consulate-general from Plaza Castilla, take the metro to Begoña - see instructions below on how to arrive by metro.

details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

The consulate is open to visitors Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 1.30pm, excluding public holidays. Consular phone lines are open from 8am to 4pm.

2018 public holidays

Our offices will be closed for the following public holidays in 2018:

Date Public holiday  
Date   Public holiday
Monday 1 January New Year’s Day
Monday 19 March San José
Thursday 29 March Maundy Thursday
Friday 30 March Good Friday
Monday 2 April Easter Monday
Tuesday 1 May Fiesta del Trabajo
Wednesday 15 August Asunción de la Virgen
Tuesday 9 October Día de la Comunidad Valenciana
Friday 12 October Fiesta Nacional de España
Thursday 1 November Día de Todos los Santos
Thursday 6 December Constitution Day
Monday 24 December Christmas Eve
Tuesday 25 December Christmas Day
Wednesday 26 December Boxing Day

Consul details

  • British Consul Sarah-Jane Morris
  • British Vice Consul Sara Munsterhjelm

Disabled access

The Alicante consulate is located on the 6th floor of a building which has lift access. Wheelchairs fit into the lift but there is no additional space for the carer to accompany the wheelchair user. Wheelchair users who are concerned about how to access the consulate should call the consulate first to ensure they are given any additional assistance needed.

How to find us

By car: approach the city along the coast road N332 or if approaching by motorway take the exit “Alicante Norte/Avenida Denia”. When you reach the marina, you will find an underground car park, and the consulate is 5 minutes walk from there.

By tram: get off at the “Mercado” stop and exit onto the Rambla Méndez Núñez. Walk down this street until you see the consulate building, which is on your left.

By bus: the bus station is located 15 minutes walk from the consulate. When you exit the bus station, turn right and continue until you reach the Rambla Méndez Núñez on your left. Turn onto the Rambla Méndez Núñez and walk up until you see the consulate on your right. Alternatively, take a taxi from the taxi rank located outside the bus station.

By train: the train station is located 20 minutes walk from the consulate. Ask for directions at the tourist information office which is located at the train station or alternatively take a taxi from the taxi rank located outside the train station.

Consul details

  • British Consul: Lloyd Milen
  • British Consul Trade and Investment: Cristina Valiñani

Disabled access

Our offices are located on the 13th floor of a building which has disabled access. The consulate-general waiting area has recently installed washroom facilities specially designed for the disabled.

Department for International Trade

The Consulate-General, via Department for International Trade, offers support to companies based in the UK to help them achieve their export potential. We can help companies by providing expert advice, reliable data and professional research. We can also help companies from outside the UK to start or expand a business in Britain. For more information visit the UK Trade and Investment website.

  • tel: (+34) 933 666 207
  • fax: (+34) 93 366 6221
  • email: uktibarcelona@fco.gov.uk

Opening hours

The consulate is open to visitors Monday to Friday from 9.00am to 13.00pm, excluding public holidays. Consular phone lines are open from 8am to 4pm.

Our offices are located on the 2nd floor of a building which has disabled access, including lifts. The consulate waiting area is equipped with facilities for disabled visitors and there is a public toilet for wheelchair users and those with limited physical mobility.

Consul details

  • British Consul Lloyd Milen
  • British Vice Consul Sharon Hodges

Disabled access

We are keen to ensure our buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Please see below details of disabled amenities at the Ibiza consulate:

  • the consulate is on the first floor of a 3 storey building with no lift. There is a disabled stair lift available. If you need to use this service on arrival, please call our intercom at the entrance to action stairlift
  • there is a public toilet for wheelchair users and those with limited physical mobility
  • there is a public service counter available for consular customers at wheelchair level
  • all doors are wheelchair accessible.

results.title: British Consulate Las Palmas de Gran Canaria

main.title: British Consulate Las Palmas de Gran Canaria

details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

The consulate is open to visitors from Monday to Friday from 8:30am to 1:30pm, excluding public holidays. Consular phone lines are open from 8am to 4pm.

2018 public holidays

Our offices will be closed for the following public holidays in 2018:

13 February Carnival Day (local holiday)
29 March Maundy Thursday
30 March Good Friday
2 April Easter Monday
1 May Día del Trabajo
30 May Día de Canarias (Regional)
15 August Asunción de la Virgen
12 October Fiesta Nacional de España
1 November Día de Todos los Santos
6 December Constitution Day
24 December Christmas Eve
25 December Christmas Day
26 December Boxing Day

Consul details

  • British Consul Charmaine Arbouin
  • British Vice Consul Esther Martin

How to find us

The consulate is located in the port area of the city of Las Palmas, on the island of Gran Canaria. We can be found opposite Parque Santa Catalina at the crossroads of Luís Morote with Albareda. There is wheelchair access.

Arriving by sea: Luis Morote Street runs almost in continuation to the Santa Catalina pier. Cross the square and gardens and past the Science Museum.

Arriving by car: Follow the road sign for “PUERTO” along the Avenida Maritima del Norte until the first road sign for “SANTA CATALINA”, turn right off the Avenida, then turn left after the underpass. An underground car park can be found on the left hand-side immediately after the Science Museum.

Arriving by bus: From Maspalomas, the resort area in the south, bus No. 30 will bring you to the Santa Catalina terminal (Intercambiador) from where it is a short walk across the Santa Catalina Square to the consulate. Other services from the resorts in the south finish at the San Telmo bus station.

From Las Palmas, bus No 12 will bring you from the San Telmo bus station to the corner of Luis Morote.

Disabled access

Wheelchair access is avaiable.

Opening hours

The consulate is open to visitors from Monday to Friday from 8:30am to 1:30pm, excluding public holidays. Consular phone lines are open from 8am to 4pm.

Disability access:

In order to enter the building there are three steps and no ramp. Once at the entrance there is a lift up to the first floor. If you require special assistance, please contact us before your visit.
